section.title: Scope
section.para: "JHotDraw 8" is an object oriented framework for developing drawing editors in the Java programming language.
It consists of two independent frameworks, and a number of demos ("samples"), which demonstrate typical uses of the framework.

The "Drawing Editor Framework" can be used to realize drawing editors for computer aided design and for artistic drawings. Drawings can be animated and interactive. It is possible to back a drawing with a data model, allowing a structured drawing editor to be used as a user interface for the data model.
The "Application Framework" can be used to create applications which comply to platform-specific user interface guidelines. Such as such as and .
The "Mini" samples demonstrate small use cases from both frameworks.
The "Grapher" sample demonstrate a working drawing editor application. It focuses on many use cases of the application framework and the drawing framework.
The "Teddy" sample demonstrates a working text editor. It focuses on the application framework only.
